quest.name: Feint and Strike
journal: Baderon has a task for a trusted adventurer.

According to Baderon, the missive intended for Ahtzapfyn is written in Sahagin script, and details plans for the destruction of the Victory. Though the message mentions a diversionary strike on Swiftperch, the Wench's proprietor seems convinced that the Serpent Reavers are lying, and that the struggling settlement is their true target. Take Baderon's hastily translated note and deliver it to Commodore Reyner at the Coral Tower.

Though Reyner is grateful for Baderon's warning, he believes Swiftperch is but one of several settlements which the Serpent Raiders could be planning to attack. While the commodore debates where to deploy his forces, a Yellowjacket arrives bearing word that South Tidegate is being assaulted by the Sahagin. Lacking the resources to defend both locations, Reyner instructs you to make haste to Swiftperch and speak with the Yellowjacket, Ryssfloh.
With the help of the Yellowjackets, you defeat the marauding Serpent Reavers and spare the residents of Swiftperch a fate worse than death.

According to Y'shtola, the Sahagin and their pirate allies were being manipulated by a masked mage she calls an “Ascian.” Though much remains shrouded in mystery, not least the strange black crystal you discovered near the mage's remains, the truth behind the kidnappings has finally come to light. Return to the Coral Tower and report to Commodore Reyner.

Your meeting with Commodore Reyner is interrupted by the appearance of Admiral Merlwyb, who commends you for your brave deeds. In recognition of your services to Limsa Lominsa, she insists that you attend a forthcoming banquet as her honored guest. Proud and daunted in equal measure, you look forward to what promises to be a memorable occasion.
objectives: Travel to Swiftperch and speak with Ryssfloh.
Report to Reyner at the Coral Tower.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Good to 'ave ye aboard, lasslad. Now then...where to start?

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Back when I was younger an' nastier, I earned me livin' as a sellsword. In that business, if ye wanted to know what yer enemy was up to, you 'ad to learn to read the orders ye prised from the cold dead 'ands of 'is mates. That's 'ow I came to know 'ow to read yer message.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Truth be told, the script was only too bloody familiar. Them's Sahagin letters, lasslad. An' I should know─I've gutted more fishback messengers than I can count.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: It gets worse, though... The plan to blow up the Victory is all in 'ere, right down to the fine details.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Looks like they meant to raise eight kinds of 'ell in western La Noscea, then 'it the Maelstrom's new flagship in the confusion.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: The point bein', the attack on the Victory weren't the act of a few rebellious pirates─'twas a key part o' some canny bastard's grand plan.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: But if I'm readin' this aright, the attack itself came much too early. I'll wager they panicked when they saw ye was on to 'em, rushed in to do the job, an' buggered it up.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Them tattoo-faced bastards as they say was payin' Ahtbyrm's old man, they're with the Serpent Reavers, right? ...But none o' their crew was there, was they? Did they 'ave summat better to do, or what?

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: ...Seven 'ells! I've got it all backwards! That mess at the Victory─that was meant to be the bloody distraction!

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: The fishbacks ain't interested in the Maelstrom's baby! They're after men, just like they've always been. They're sendin' their pirate lackeys after a civilian target.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: This bit about raisin' 'ell in western La Noscea...that's where it'll be. Summat tells me Swiftperch is about to get 'it, an' 'it 'ard!

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: 'Ere's a rough translation o' the message.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Take it to Commodore Reyner at the Coral Tower, an' tell 'im 'e's in fer a busy day.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Oh, an' give 'im an 'and, eh? Ye can be damn sure 'e'll need one.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: Yes, I am Reyner. Ah, you must be the adventurer whose name seems to be on everyone's lips.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: You are to be commended for your part in thwarting the plot to destroy the Victory. Now, what can I do for you this day?

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: You bear an urgent message from Baderon? Why do I get the feeling that my hopes for a quiet eveningmorningafternoon are about to be cruelly dashed? Tell me, what is afoot?

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: An assault on Swiftperch!? But we've seen nothing to suggest the Serpent Reavers are massing for an attack.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: Even so, it would be foolish to discount the possibility─Baderon is rarely wrong about such matters.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: I will marshal the Yellowjackets for battle immediately.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: The only question is where to send them. While I concur with Baderon's assessment that the attack on the Drydocks was intended as a diversion, Swiftperch is but one of several possible targets for the main thrust.

dialogue.name: YELLOWJACKET
dialogue.text: Commodore, sir!

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: Report.

dialogue.name: YELLOWJACKET
dialogue.text: It's the Sahagin, sir! They've mounted a large-scale assault on South Tidegate, and threaten to overwhelm our defenses within the day. The garrison requests immediate reinforcements.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: By the Navigator... It seems my decision has been made for me.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: Muster the troops and give the order to march.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: Aye, the Serpent Reavers are in league with the Sahagin.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: ...Which means there is every chance this assault on Tidegate may yet prove to be another feint. The fact remains, however, that we can ill afford to ignore it. And that leaves Swiftperch vulnerable to those pirate traitors.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: It is at times such as these that I wish the Warriors of Light yet walked among us. But wishes will avail us naught. Surname, you must serve in their absence. Make for Swiftperch with all haste and lend your strength to the squads I can spare for the settlement's defense.

dialogue.name: RYSSFLOH
dialogue.text: Commodore Reyner sent word we'd be getting reinforcements, but I didn't expect him to send you! You certainly look like you've seen your share of action, though─you bear little resemblance to the wide-eyed whelp I met fresh off the ferry.

dialogue.name: RYSSFLOH
dialogue.text: In any case, do you know what you're fighting for here? This place─Swiftperch─it was rebuilt by folk who stood strong in the face of every hardship the Calamity threw their way.

dialogue.name: RYSSFLOH
dialogue.text: And we're not about to let some fish-fancying scum claim the honor of being the ones who finally broke their spirits. Don't give those pirate bastards one bloody ilm, you hear me?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text:
Duty calls. Do you wish to proceed with
“Feint and Strike”?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: GLAZRAEL
dialogue.text: Here they come!

dialogue.name: DECKMAN
dialogue.text: 'Ere now, I thought all them Yellowjacket worms was meant to be busy. That useless scrag ain't followed the plan, 'as 'e?

dialogue.name: HELMSMAN
dialogue.text: Now what? Pull back and wait for our Sahagin brothers?

dialogue.name: BAENRYSS
dialogue.text: Piss on that! We ain't turnin' back empty-handed!

dialogue.name: BAENRYSS
dialogue.text: Remember, no killin' the smallfolk, or it'll be your blood what stains Lord Leviathan's altars!

dialogue.name: BAENRYSS
dialogue.text: The Yellowbellies ye can butcher at will! Them dirt-eatin' slugs'll be crushed under the full might o' the Serpent Reavers!

dialogue.name: RYSSFLOH
dialogue.text: Seems Swiftperch was the main target after all, eh?

dialogue.name: RYSSFLOH
dialogue.text: Squads One and Two, protect the townsfolk! Squad Three, you're our rear guard!

dialogue.name: RYSSFLOH
dialogue.text: The rest of you─we meet their charge where we stand! Let us bear the commodore word of our victory, or no word at all!

dialogue.name: YELLOWJACKETS
dialogue.text: (-Yellowjacket Infantry-)For Limsa Lominsa!

dialogue.name: BAENRYSS
dialogue.text: Rargh! I'll gut all you Yellowbellies an' dance on yer gizzards!

dialogue.name: RYSSFLOH
dialogue.text: Well fought─the Reavers are beaten and scattered.

dialogue.name: RYSSFLOH
dialogue.text: I'll take some men and hunt down the stragglers. Oh, but there may be more of them lurking about, so don't let your guard down just yet.

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: The source of herhis strength becomes clear...

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: You may have bested the golem, but you will not fare so well this day.

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: O mournful voice of creation! Send unto me a creature of the abyss, my thrall to command, that I may smite mine enemies!

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: Your very being imperils the plan. You cannot be suffered to live.

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: Unnngh... That the wisdom of the Paragons should be brought low...by mere mortals...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: “Paragons,” did he say? Then it is as I feared.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: They are known as the Bringers of Chaos...or Ascians, to give them their proper name.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: It would seem our suspicions were correct─it is they who have been manipulating the beast tribes.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text:
Pardon? You would know if we Sharlayans have encountered Ascians before?
...I have never spoken to you of my homeland. How did you know whence I hail?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Wait. I do begin to see. You have been blessed with a special gift.

dialogue.name: RYSSFLOH
dialogue.text: Are you all right, lasslad!? If I'd known a mean bugger like that was hiding in the bushes, I would've left a squad or six to keep you company.

dialogue.name: RYSSFLOH
dialogue.text: Well, at least now we can call this kidnapping investigation to a close. Those Reavers were the ones spiriting folk away in the dead of night, and this bastard here was pulling all the strings.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: A trifle simplistic, but not inaccurate.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I came as soon as I sensed his presence, but I never thought to find such a scene of carnage. Yet we prevailed. And thanks to your heroic actions, I have learned much.

dialogue.name: RYSSFLOH
dialogue.text: Aye, “heroic” is the word. I don't want to think about what would've happened if you hadn't been here, friend.

dialogue.name: RYSSFLOH
dialogue.text: And your assistance is much appreciated, too, Lady Y'shtola. Please give our regards to the Scions.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I am glad to have played a role in bringing what I hope is an end to this disturbing spate of abductions.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The thread of your fate forms a part of a most intriguing tapestry. Mayhap we will be afforded the chance to speak more in the near future.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: For now, however, you must see this particular tale to its conclusion. Pray send my greetings to Commodore Reyner.

dialogue.name: GLAZRAEL
dialogue.text: Feint after bloody feint! Those pirates are getting too damn clever by half!

dialogue.name: YELLOWJACKETA
dialogue.text: You've come to aid with the defense? Then well met, and well come!

dialogue.name: YELLOWJACKETB
dialogue.text: Come on, you gutless bastards! Let's see how you fare against trained soldiers!

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: Surname, eagerly have I awaited your return!

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: Word of your exploits is already spreading through the ranks. My troops and I owe you a great debt of gratitude for your timely assistance.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: You have shown yourself to be possessed of a sure arm, a strong spirit, and sound judgment. Would that Limsa Lominsa had more of your like.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: I have little doubt that you shall one day join the ranks of Eorzea's greatest adventurers. It is but a matter of time.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: Clearly, Baderon's eye for potential remains as sharp as ever, though I doubt even he imagined you capable of such feats.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: Might you favor me with your own account of the day's events? Such victories bear retelling!

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: Y'shtola has been working with us for quite some time, you see.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: And she was only too willing to assist the Yellowjackets in the kidnapping investigation, proving herself a stalwart ally of Limsa Lominsa yet again.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: Needless to say, after your part in thwarting the attempted sabotage of the Victory, and the small matter of your deeds at Swiftperch, you too have proven yourself a valued friend of the thalassocracy.

dialogue.name: YELLOWJACKET
dialogue.text: Admiral!

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: May I present to you Admiral Bloefhiswyn.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: So this is the adventurer I've been reading about in the field reports.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: You seem familiar. Have we met? Mayhap at a medal presentation or some such?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: No? Have you kin in the Maelstrom?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I'll be sworn I─ But it is of little matter. To business.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I am Merlwyb Bloefhiswyn, Admiral of Limsa Lominsa.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: On behalf of my people, I bid you thanks for the deeds you have done this day.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: A token of our gratitude. What worth is high regard without just reward, after all? Ha!

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Since you first set foot in our city, my good friend Baderon and Commodore Reyner have taken turns at regaling me with tales of your exploits.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Safe to say, they left an impression. Join me at the coming banquet.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: A seat of honor at the celebratory feast is the least I can offer the womanman who foiled the Sahagin.

dialogue.name: YELLOWJACKET
dialogue.text: Oho!

dialogue.name: YELLOWJACKET
dialogue.text: A seat at the feast!

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Oh, and don't be late.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Your fellow guests will be eager to take the measure of their newest hero, and some do not take kindly to being kept waiting. Till then, may you walk in the light of the Crystal.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the Serpent Reavers.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Leave no pirate scum standing! Show 'em how a Yellowjacket fights!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Bwahaha! Time to split some heads, adventurer! Let's start with the frontline fodder!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Is that a bloody voidsent!? Hold steady, lads!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: More of the bastards!? Come on, then!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: All right, ye scurvy bastards... Here's a trick to make ye soil yer breeches!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Dweller o' the Abyss, yer master calls! Heed me words an' smite me foes!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Damn...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Least I went down fighting...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: So cold...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I'm done for...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Keep on pummeling him! He can't take much more of this!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the masked mage!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Soon, you shall take your vile gifts to the grave!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Mwahahaha! Writhe as the venom eats its way through your veins!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: An unwelcome guest. No matter, all shall fall before me!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Whence springs this preternatural might!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: A fearsome opponent...against whom you shall not stand alone!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: No mortal should possess such strength!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: His power wanes! Afford him no chance to recover!
